alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Monmouth; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 1:31PM EST until January 14 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northeastern Ocean County in southern New Jersey... Monmouth County in central New Jersey... Southeastern Middlesex County in northern New Jersey... * Until 200 PM EST. * At 131 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Keansburg to Imlaystown, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow and gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 9 and 34. Garden State Parkway between mile markers 92 and 122. Locations impacted include... Long Branch, Asbury Park, Sandy Hook, Lakewood, Middletown, Old Bridge, Howell, Marlboro, Manalapan, Tinton Falls, Holmdel, Red Bank, Keansburg, Matawan, Manasquan, Highlands, Point Pleasant Beach, Allentown, Farmingdale, and Roosevelt. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
